subject: Re: [junit] Do JUnit internals suck?!?
msgSnippet: On Wed, 2002-10-02 at 15:49, J. B. Rainsberger wrote: So said  Dave Astels  on  2002-10-02 Renaming TestCase to TestFixture would have made it clearer for me
messageBody:
On Wed, 2002-10-02 at 15:49, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

So said Dave Astels on 2002-10-02

Renaming TestCase to TestFixture would have made it clearer for me in
the beginning. The use of the term "test case" to represent a
collection of tests with common fixture is a nonstandard use of the
term. It sounds to me like nothing more than a name that looked good at
first, but wasn't changed when perhaps it could have been. Everything
is a TestSuite, although most of them are automatically generated for
us. Once I made that connexion, everything became clear.

>Anyone think this would make a good topic for the TDD Coad Letter?

Yes.

OK. It's on my list. To help me focus it better, I would appreciate
input from the community with regard to what questions you would like to
see answered/explored.

Dave

________________________________________________________________________
Dave Astels
Coauthor of "A Practical Guide to XP"
Editor of the Test-Driven Development Edition of The Coad Letter
CEO & Master Software Craftsman

An Agile Software Studio
